intro: Atragene crassisepala, commonly known as the broad-sepaled starling plant, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and have a rough texture. The plant is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
